hero.headline: Legal AI Tools Built for How Paralegals Actually Work
hero.subheadline: Paralegals handle the document-intensive work that keeps litigation moving. Dodonai automates the most time-consuming parts — record review, deposition summaries, transcript search — so you can manage more cases at higher quality.

sections.heading: How Paralegals Use AI to Work More Efficiently
paragraphs: Paralegals are the backbone of document processing in litigation. Building medical chronologies, drafting deposition digests, searching transcript testimony, organizing discovery, preparing privilege logs — these tasks consume most of a paralegal's day. They're also where AI tools for legal paralegals deliver the most immediate productivity gains.

Dodonai is designed for the way paralegals actually work. Upload a stack of medical records and get a complete chronology in minutes instead of spending a full day reading SOAP notes. Upload a deposition transcript and receive a page-line summary instead of hours drafting one from scratch. Search across all transcripts in a case with a natural language query instead of scrolling through hundreds of pages.

AI handles the reading, extracting, and formatting — the mechanical labor that eats up time without requiring your expertise. You handle the analysis and quality control attorneys depend on: reviewing chronologies for case issues, flagging testimony inconsistencies, and making sure work product is right before it goes to the attorney.

cards.title: Medical Record Summaries and Chronologies
cards.description: A full day of manual record review, done in minutes. Upload plaintiff medical records and receive a structured {{link:/ai-medical-record-summaries-chronologies/|medical chronology}} with provider timelines, diagnoses, treatments, and source citations — freeing you for higher-value case prep.

cards.title: Deposition Summary Drafting
cards.description: Generate {{link:/deposition-summary-software/|page-line and narrative deposition summaries}} from uploaded transcripts. Specify key topics to focus on the issues your supervising attorney cares about most, then review and edit before finalizing.

cards.title: AI Transcript Search
cards.description: Find specific testimony across multiple depositions without re-reading entire transcripts. {{link:/ai-deposition-transcript-software/|AI-powered search}} works by topic, witness name, or natural language question — results in seconds.

cards.title: AI OCR for Scanned Documents
cards.description: Scanned records, faxed documents, handwritten notes — {{link:/ai-pdf-ocr/|AI-powered OCR}} extracts text from files too poor for standard tools, so nothing gets missed during review.

cards.title: Extract and Draft Agents
cards.description: Build reusable {{link:/dodonai-extract-and-draft-agents/|Extract and Draft Agents}} for recurring tasks: pulling data from insurance policies, extracting billing information, or generating summaries that match your firm's templates.

cards.title: E-Discovery Document Review
cards.description: First-pass relevance review, privilege log identification, meet-and-confer prep — {{link:/electronic-discovery-software/|Dodonai's e-discovery tools}} help you find relevant documents faster across large productions.

items.title: Upload Your Documents
items.description: Upload medical records, deposition transcripts, discovery productions, or any other case documents. The platform handles PDFs, Word files, text files, and scanned documents with no formatting required.

items.title: Select the Task and Customize
items.description: Choose your output — medical chronology, deposition summary, transcript search, document extract, or e-discovery review. Add key topics or date ranges to tailor the results. Processing completes in minutes.

items.title: Review, Refine, and Deliver
items.description: Review the AI output with side-by-side source linking to the original documents. Make edits, then export as PDF, Word, Excel, or text — ready for attorney review or direct inclusion in case files.

faq.question: Will AI replace paralegals in law firms?
faq.answer: No. AI automates the repetitive parts — reading hundreds of pages, extracting data, formatting outputs. That frees paralegals for the analytical work: evaluating chronologies for case issues, spotting testimony inconsistencies, organizing exhibits, and communicating with attorneys. Paralegals who use AI tools handle more cases at higher quality.

faq.question: How much time can a paralegal save using Dodonai?
faq.answer: A medical chronology that takes 8-12 hours manually is generated in under 15 minutes. A deposition digest that takes 3-5 hours is ready in about 3 minutes. Transcript searches take seconds. Most paralegals report saving several hours per day on document processing.

faq.question: Do I need technical skills to use Dodonai?
faq.answer: No. Upload a document, select the output type, optionally enter key topics, and download. Most paralegals are comfortable within their first session. No coding or IT support required.

faq.question: Can I customize the output to match my firm's templates?
faq.answer: Yes. Multiple export formats including PDF, Word, Excel, and plain text. Customize detail level, filter by provider or date range, and adjust summary structure. For advanced customization, {{link:/dodonai-extract-and-draft-agents/|Extract and Draft Agents}} let you build reusable templates matching your firm's exact requirements.

faq.question: Is Dodonai secure enough for confidential legal documents?
faq.answer: Built on HIPAA-compliant, SOC 2-certified infrastructure with AES-256 encryption. We sign BAAs, don't train on your documents, and you keep full deletion control.

faq.question: How much does Dodonai cost for a paralegal to use?
faq.answer: Plans are based on page volume, not user seats — per-page costs range from $0.15 down to $0.02 depending on plan. Multiple paralegals and attorneys can share the same account. Visit our {{link:/pricing/|pricing page}} for details.
